top_pain_points.pain: Time to identify and resolve production ML issues is too long
top_pain_points.example_quote: time to issues identification and resolution

top_pain_points.pain: Data scientists spending majority of time debugging vs building new models
No unified platform for observability across ML and LLM workloads
Production incidents from model degradation impacting user experience
Lack of root cause analysis tools for complex ML systems
top_pain_points.example_quote: Ability to drive to root-cause immediately improves workflow and time-to-resolution.

winning_value_props.value: Drive to root cause immediately - dramatically reduces time-to-resolution
Proactive monitoring catches issues before they impact users
Self-serve debugging lets DS teams move faster without ops bottlenecks
Single platform for both traditional ML and LLM observability

common_objections.objection: We're building our own monitoring internally
common_objections.effective_response: Many software companies start there but find it creates technical debt. Chartboost switched to Arize because internal tools couldn't keep up - they needed to drive to root cause immediately, and custom tooling couldn't deliver that.

common_objections.objection: We already use DataDog/New Relic for monitoring
common_objections.effective_response: APM tools are great for infrastructure but don't understand ML-specific metrics like drift, feature importance, or embedding analysis. Arize complements your APM by providing ML-native observability.

common_objections.objection: Our ML team is too busy to implement new tooling
common_objections.effective_response: That's exactly the problem - they're busy debugging instead of building. Arize customers report 80% reduction in troubleshooting time. Would getting that time back justify a short implementation?

discovery_questions.question: When a production ML issue occurs, how long does it typically take your team to identify the root cause?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: What's the business impact during that troubleshooting window?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_no: What tools enable that fast resolution?

discovery_questions.question: What percentage of your data science team's time is spent on debugging vs building new models?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: Is that ratio acceptable to leadership?

discovery_questions.question: Are you adopting or planning to adopt LLMs alongside your traditional ML models?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: How are you planning to monitor both under one platform?

discovery_questions.question: How do you currently detect when a model starts degrading before users notice?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: How quickly can you respond once detected?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_no: What's the cost when degradation reaches users?
